DOC.brief_title: Inhaled Nitric Oxide Preterm Infants With Severe Respiratory Failure
DOC.detailed_description: This multicenter , randomize , double-masked , control clinical trial evaluate efficacy inhale nitric oxide ( iNO ) treatment preterm infant respiratory failure secondary respiratory distress syndrome ( RDS ) , sepsis/pneumonia , aspiration syndrome , idiopathic pulmonary hypertension and/or suspect pulmonary hypoplasia . Infants follow death discharge home . The trial compare iNO therapy mock gas delivery control , otherwise incorporate conventional management strategy ( include treatment surfactant high frequency ventilation adjuncts iNO therapy ) . During initial dosing , iNO start 5 ppm could increase 10 ppm . If infant respond , study gas discontinue . For infant respond study gas , gradual weaning initiate . The total exposure study gas exceed 336 hour ( 14 day ) . Infants monitor sign toxicity . Medical neurodevelopmental outcome survive infant assess 18 22 month correct age mask , certified examiner .
